projects.description: I practiced my knowledge of basic JavaScript syntax and data structures by building a Random Quote Generator, a program that displays a randomly selected quote each time the user clicks a button.

In this project, I used a common web development technique known as “pagination” to enhance the usability of a web page. I started with a file that contained information for 42 students, including name, email, and picture. I used my JavaScript skills to display the first nine students on the page. Then, I added navigation, also known as pagination buttons, that the user can click to display different pages of students.

In this project, I used JavaScript to enhance an interactive registration form for a fictional Full Stack conference. Using the supplied HTML and CSS files, I added my own JavaScript to make the form more user-friendly by adding customized and conditional behavior and interactivity, and validating user input and providing helpful error messages when the user enters invalid information into the form fields.

projects.project_name: Object Oriented Programming Game Show App
projects.description: In this project, I created a browser-based, word guessing game called Phrase Hunter. You’ll use JavaScript and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) to select a random, hidden phrase, which a player tries to guess, by clicking letters on an onscreen keyboard.
